column4: Hi I was wondering if someone could help me with usb support for virtualbox?
you might be better off with a virtualbox channel i'd imagine, if there is one
but you're wanting to file share with the VM right?
well, your VM has a working internet connection and has an IP address on the same network yeah? so they can ping one another? (firewalls permitting)
i wouldn't expect so, you could try without
so, decide on sharing a folder from which (probably the ubuntu host preferably), so create a folder called "share" in your home folder for example to start with
i'm doing this right now too, between two networked physical PCs for fun, as i've never done it the easy way
so i've right clicked on the folder "share" i created in my home directory, (Places -> Home) and i'm enabling sharing
no problemo ^_^ if i can get it to work, haha - so it's asking me to install a 'service'
ugh it wants me to restart my session to complete
i ticked the boxes to allow read+write and guest access, then from my win7 desktop browsed to: \\IP of ubuntu PC\share
it asked me for user+pass so i put "guest" as user and blank pass, then just hit enter and it worked \o/
did you create a folder inside your home?
is there a space in its' name?
